notes: People massively protested against the bad conditions of roads in the Eastern region.
Clashes reported between the Malian army and unknown gunmen aboard motorbikes in Bentia, south of Ansongo.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA vehicle was lightly damaged after being struck by an IED this morning in Kidal.
44 people were arrested in the Pama and Nadiagou area after protests and arson attacks related to the shooting death of an alleged poacher in the area.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
source: Xinhua News Agency - French; MENASTREAM; UN News Service; Long War Journal
notes: 2 MINUSMA peacekeepers were injured and one civilian seriously injured when their vehicle hit a mine south of Tessalit on Tuesday. A similar attack occurred on Sunday.
About 200 police protested in Ouagadougou over the alleged lack of transparency over their provision of security to private companies.
44 people were arrested in the Pama and Nadiagou area after protests and arson attacks related to the shooting death of an alleged poacher in the area.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: JNIM claimed an attack against an army post in Gourma-Rharous, during which 5 FACA soldiers and 10 militants were killed, and as many as a dozen soldiers were injured. As the militants retreated, MINUSMA forces carried out airstrikes against the militants, which caused most of the casualties against them.
Youth Coordination Bual Hamu blocked Road 4 Fada-Niger borders to ask for the road to be asphalted.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: JNIM claimed an IED which destroyed two MINUSMA vehicles carrying Chadian peacekeepers in the Taghlit area on the Aguelhok-Tessalit axis on Sunday. 3 people, including 2 peacekeepers and 1 civilian, were severely injured in the attack.

Police allegedly violently dispersed a peaceful march in Nouakchott, arresting several demonstrators and injuring several. The march was organized to protest against youth marginalization, unemployment, and bad standard of living. 10 of those present were arrested.
Residents of Douna staged a march in support of the mayor over alleged activity against him by local representatives of the CDP and the UPC.

assoc_actor_1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Members of the CMA protested over the arrest by French Barkhane forces of some of their fighters and an officer of the MAA. They demanded their release and the return of their weapons.
Persistent mass protests have been reported throughout the week by the students in Niamey.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: JNIM claimed an attack that targeted a Malian gendarmerie post in Tene, Segou.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a gendarmerie post in Tene in the Segou region. 3 motorcycles were seized and the post was burnt but no casualties were reported.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: A humanitarian worker and their driver were abducted in Diafarabe in Tenenkou cercle. They were later released.

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle targeted MINUSMA forces with gunfire in the Bera area of Gao.
Sporadic clashes have been reported between police and students in Niamey following violent protests on Apr.10.

At least 10 Chadian soldiers were killed and 2 were injured in an attack by unidentified assailants on a prisoner convoy about 60km away from N'Djamena, heading for Koro Toro. Chadian soldiers were believed to have been involved in the attack, which resulted in as many as 80 soldiers released.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: JNIM claimed an ambush against a Dozo convoy in Ke-Macina, Segou, killing and wounding several (fatalities coded as 3).
12 activists of the Iyina movement were arrested as they prepared to demonstrate at the Labour Exchange in N'Djamena over alleged mismanagement by the government. They were later released.

Violent protests took place at the University of Niamey campus including clashes between students and police which led to at least one student killed and over 100 injured (88 protesters, 21 police). As many as 313 people were arrested out of the more than 20,000 students reported to have participated in the protests. The students reportedly blocked traffic and built barricades, and threw stones while the police used tear gas. The protesters were demanding better living/studying conditions.

Military forces in Niger claim they have killed 57 Boko Haram fighters while 15 soldiers and 2 civilians were lightly wounded in Gueskerou in the Diffa region. The Boko Haram fighters had attacked an army position in the area resulting in the clash.
Multiple airstrikes targeting suspected Islamist militants were reported in the Mondoro/Fhero forest area near Burkina Faso's border by French forces.

actor2: CJA: Congress for Justice in Azawad
source: Kibaru; Xinhua News Agency - French; RFI; AFP
notes: At least 5 people were killed, including 4 CJA fighters, in an attack by suspected Islamist gunmen on CJA positions in Gargando, west of Goundam.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-); Military Forces of Mali (2013-)
notes: Clashes were reported between tripartite forces (French, Burkinabe and Malian) and Islamist militants in the Tin Tehegrin area near the Burkina-Niger border.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA-chartered truck was attacked by unidentified gunmen between Gao and Gossi. No casualties reported.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: A vehicle of the ICRC was hit by gunfire while traveling along the Gao-Gossi road. The driver was wounded.
Several civilians were injured in Gao when unidentified assailants fired into a crowd.
A person searching for their missing cattle was abducted by suspected Islamist fighters in Diafarabe. He was later found dead.

actor2: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
notes: 2 MAA fighters (members of the CMA) were killed and at least 6 wounded while some of their vehicles were seized during an attack by an unidentified armed group on their positions in Anefis.

assoc_actor_1: AFKK: Koglweogo Womens Association of Kouritenga
notes: The women's association Koglweogo Kouritenga protested against a court decision against some of their husbands related to some vigilante activities.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: 7 Dozo hunters (Bambara) were killed and their leader captured during an attack against a Fulani self-defense group's position between Koroguiri and Kiguiri in Tenenkou Cercle. JNIM later claimed responsibility.
A gendarmerie checkpost was attacked and set on fire in San by unidentified gunmen.

actor1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
assoc_actor_1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: One person was killed and 2 injured following an attack on MNLA fighters (members of the CMA) by unidentified assailants in Kidal.
A humanitarian worker and two health workers were abducted and had their vehicle seized by unidentified gunmen in Kadial, between Tenenkou and Mopti.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: A French soldier was killed by gunfire in the Douna area as they searched the area for explosives following a roadside blast earlier in the day. AQM claimed the attack.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: A French LAV hit a roadside explosive in area of Douna village, injuring 2. AQM claimed responsibility.

assoc_actor_1: SYNATEB: National Union of Basic Education Workers
notes: The SYNATEB affiliated gathered in front of the town hall for a sit-in asking the revision of a new document imposting heavier administrative burden on workers.
2 youths suspected of a robbery were lynched by a mob in Gao. One was killed while the other was injured.
2 young shepherds were killed in an IED blast in a forest near Mondoro.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
assoc_actor_2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: AQM claimed grad rocket attacks against a joint Barkhane-MINUSMA base in Amachach.
The mayor of Konna says that 2 youths were mistaken for militants and killed by gendarmerie in the area.
Kolgweogo in Pouytenga and surrounding areas gathered in Koupela to protest over the alleged condemnation of their comrades.
An imam was assassinated by unidentified gunmen in the Missabougou-Balobougou neighbourhood of Bamako.
2 educational consultants and the driver of a vehicle owned by CAP were wounded by unidentified gunmen in the Gniminama area as it was traveling from Konna to Douentza.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: 2 Malian gendarmes and a civilian were killed and one gendarme went missing during an attack on a joint police/army checkpost in Boulikessi by AQM fighters.
A number of teachers protested against the non-payment of salaries, being overdue more than 4 months.
A Nigerien soldier and 3 suspected Boko Haram militants were killed, while 11 others were injured, in an ambush by the militants against a Niger/Chad joint military patrol in the Bosso area.

Unidentified armed individuals on motorcycles raided the HQ of the Koglweogo in Kereboule, which they found empty. They then opened fire for nearly a quarter of an hour before leaving. At least one person was seriously injured during the firing.
Security Measures: Burkinabe soldiers backed by Barkhane forces have started a large-scale search and clear operation in Soum province. Malian forces are also participating across the border.
A Mauritanian soldier and another person were killed and one person wounded in the Riyadh suburb of Nouakchott after an armed explosive was found on the roadside. Another explosive was defused.
2 army vehicles were hit by an IED near Niala.
The chief of Dogon section of yirma village near Boni was killed at his home by unidentified assailants.
Unidentified assailants robbed two busses near Intahaka after leaving Gao. Some of the passengers who resisted were wounded, and one later died in hospital.
Unidentified assailants clashed with security forces in the Boni area.
A customs post in Ouelessebougou was attacked by suspected Islamist militants. At least one customs officer was killed and another wounded.
3 people were killed and 4 wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants on a Malian army post in Almoustarat. Vehicles were also seized by the attackers.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: AQM claims to have taken control of a checkpost in Djenne.

Malian soldiers raided Kouakourou in the Kewa area and clashed with alleged Islamist militants, killing 10. At least 8 other alleged Islamist militants were arrested, while 30 others were also reported arrested (not clear if they were also militants or just suspected of affiliation).
Security posts in Djenne were attacked by unidentified assailants. No casualties reported.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: AQM claims to have killed and wounded dozens of Dozos (Bambara hunters) and seized/destroyed motorcycles during clashes in the Macina area (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: A Malian army vehicle hit an IED between Manga and Koina, killing 2 soldiers and severely wounding several others. AQM claimed responsibility for a blast in the area.
A French national working for a French company was kidnapped by unidentified assailants in Abeche.
At least 3 people were killed at Diaka in Tenenkou Cercle in fighting between Fulani and Bambara.
3 people were lightly wounded after their transport truck hit an IED in the Tabrichat area near Tessalit.

assoc_actor_2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
source: Nord Sud Journal; AFP -- English; RFI; Long War Journal
notes: At least 10 people were killed and 14 others injured in clashes between Bambara and Fulani in the Diabaly area of Niono. The clashes were either due to a Fulani shepherd being killed or Fulani cattle rustling. AQM militants claimed that they joined the fight and supported the Fulani.
A suspected Ansaroul Islam lieutenant was killed by security forces in the Petega area near Djibo. 18 other suspected militants were also arrested.
A youth organization (ODJ) organized a sit-in in Koudougou to protest against water shortages in the city.
A young Fulani shepherd was allegedly killed by Bambara militiamen in Niono district of Segou.
The National Union of Tax Estate Agents started a strike and protested in the capital in favour of their demands.
A Malian gendarmerie post was attacked in the Tonka area.

In late March 2017, gendarmes in Sevare allegedly beat seven men from a village near Djenne, including a Quranic teacher. 'During the night, a few of the gendarmes came into our cell and kicked and beat us. One man broke a few ribs and two others bled from their noses,' one detainee said.
Unidentified assailants attacked a joint-police/military camp in Nassoumbou. At least one soldier was wounded in a rocket attack, although gunfire was also reported.
Koglweogo militiamen and an unidentified armed group clashed in the Kereboule area. No injuries reported.
Sewage worked protested in front of the presidential palace in Nouakchott to demand that they finally receive their salaries that are 6 months overdue.

actor1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: A gendarme was injured in an attack by unidentified assailants in an ambush in the Petega area.

actor1: MNLA: National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad
notes: Unidentified assailants killed an MNLA officer in the Ouzayane valley north of Abeibara.
A Bambara hunter was killed in an ambush by unidentified gunmen in the Tougou area of Segou. Intercommunal violence targeting Bambara was recently reported in the area.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: GATIA's commander Almahdi Ag Lengach was killed in Menaka by 3 unidentified assailants who arrived on motorcycles.
One Bambara community member was killed and several wounded during intercommunal violence reported in the Dogofri-Diabaly area.

assoc_actor_1: SYNAGRH: National Union of Human Resource Managers and Public Administration
notes: SYNAGRH members protested and started a 72-hour sit-in in Ouagadougou to demand attention to their grievances.

Property destruction: A school was burned down in the Baraboule area by suspected Islamist militants. Islamist groups, particularly Ansaroul Islam, have been targeting schools and teachers in the area recently.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: At least 4 people were killed, including 2 soldiers and 2 civilians, in an attack by 9 suspected AQM fighters on Fafa. 2 military vehicles were also stolen by the attackers. Some people were also reported injured. Other sources said 3 civilians had been killed.

Workers at the Indian Quartz company, that extracts quartz mineral in Mauritania, protested against unpaid wages. Workers said that they have taken all the steps in order to get their dues over the last two months but the company ignored them. Workers said that they will continue to strike until they get paid.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Unidentified assailants attacked a GATIA checkpost in Tin-Hama. The attack was repelled without reported injuries.

At least 3 people were injured in an attack by unidentified assailants on two buses owned by a Mauritanian company which were travelling from Bamako to Nouakchott. The bus carried people of various nationalities.

assoc_actor_1: FNDU: National Forum for Democracy and Unity, RFD: Rally of Democratic Forces
notes: Tens of thousands of people marched in Nouakchoot on the call of the FNDU and RFD against proposed constitutional reforms that were approved by the Mauritanian legislature.
Teachers marched in Ouagadougou and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Education to protest against initimidation of teachers in Soum by suspected Islamist militants.

Police dispersed a protest of the opposition in Nouakchott with tear gas and batons. The opposition activists were protesting against proposed constitutional reforms being considered by the parliament.
Armed groups took control of Timbuktu to prevent Malian interim authorities from being installed in the area. No clashes were reported.
7 people were killed and 4 gendarmes wounded in an attack by suspected Islamist militants on Wanzarbe in the Bankilare area.
Nigerien security forces were attacked by suspected Islamist militants in the Dolbel area.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The MINUSMA camp in Tessalit was attacked by rockets and mortars. No group claimed responsibility.

actor2: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: 5 gendarmes were killed in an attack by AQM militants in the Tillaberi region.

assoc_actor_1: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (CMA)
actor2: MAA: Arab Movement of the Azawad (Platform)
notes: 2 civilians and an MAA-CMA officer were killed in an attack by MAA fighters from a different faction on a Malian army checkpoint outside Timbuktu.

source: Nord Sud Journal; MENASTREAM; RFI; AP International
notes: At least 11 soldiers were killed and 4 injured in an attack by Ansaroul Islam fighters on an army position in the Boulkessi area of Mopti. 2 Ansaroul Islam fighters were reported wounded.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The MINUSMA camp in Aguelhok was hit by rockets/mortars. No group claimed responsibility.
2 civilians were killed and 3 abducted by suspected Islamist militants in Funtonde, 8km from Boni.

Thousands of people marched in Niamey to protest against the government. They called for improved living conditions and the release of political prisoners. The march was called by an alliance of 11 opposition groups.
A school principal and another civilian were killed in an attack by suspected Ansaroul Islam fighters on a school in the Djibo area of Soum.
A teacher and another person were killed at Kourfayel in Soum province by suspected Islamist militants.
Youths in Koiratao (Niafunke) repulsed an attack by armed bandits. They captured one and handed him over to the army.

Non-violent activity: Schools in the Fourtenga commune of Nassere (Kongoussi) were visited by suspected Islamist militants who threatened to close them down if the teachers did not start teaching in Arabic.

A soldier was killed and 7 others injured, including 3 soldiers and 4 police, in a confrontation between soldiers and police in Dosso. The altercation started after police stopped a military vehicle for their driving.

assoc_actor_1: CCVC: National Coalition against High Cost of Living, Corruption, Fraud and Impunity and for Liberty
notes: CCVC organized a national phone boycott against a new tax set to come in relating to communications services.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Non-violent activity: Ansar Dine, al-Mourabitoun and AQIM have announced their merger into a new group, "Jama'at Nusrat al-Islam wal Muslimeen," which translates to "Group in Support of Islam and Muslims".

Property destruction: Diguel was attacked by suspected Ansaroul Islam fighters in the early morning of Feb.28. They ransacked the mayors office, stole some property and burned down a prefecture building.
Ansaroul Islam fighters attacked 2 police stations in northern Burkina Faso at Baraboule and Tongomayel, injuring the wife of a police officer and destroying as many as 19 police motorcycles.
About 2,000 armed members of the Ganda Izo vigilante group picketed the regional assembly to demand the cancellation of the implementation of interim authorities.

assoc_actor_1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad (Splinter Faction)
notes: Elements of the CMA2 (dissenters from the peace process) picketed the regional assembly in Timbuktu demanding that they be involved in decision-making and other initiatives related to Timbuktu region.
Ansaroul Islam fighters attacked 2 police stations in northern Burkina Faso at Baraboule and Tongomayel, injuring the wife of a police officer and destroying as many as 19 police motorcycles.
At least 6 soldiers were killed in an ambush of their convoy as they were traveling on the road to Agadez. No group claimed responsibility.
6 people were killed and 10 injured in a dispute between two families in Gore. Police intervened to restore order.

A journalist was abducted by unidentified assailants in N'Djamena after leaving church. The arrest came shortly after he released an article critical of the president and security/intelligence services.
60 students were arrested following a protest during which they threw stones at the cars of the Minister of Higher Education and his visiting Senegalese counterpart in N'Djamena.
Dozens of allegedly "well-organized" young Muslims ransacked bars and liquor stalls in Timbuktu during a protest against alcohol.

source: Nord Sud Journal; Le Figaro.fr; Niger Inter; AFP -- English; Xinhua News Agency - French; Mauritanian Sahara Media news website
notes: At least 16 soldiers were killed, including one officer, as many as 19 wounded, seven vehicles stolen, and four more burned by suspected Islamist fighters in an attack near Tilwa in the Ouallam area, near Mangaize. Other reports said at least 15 soldiers had been killed. An IS linked group led by Abou El Walid El Sahraou is believed to have carried out the attack.
10 Dozo hunters (Bambara) were killed and 13 wounded when they were ambushed by Islamist militants in the Diabaly area.
3 soldiers were killed in the Diffa area in an attack by suspected Boko Haram fighters.
2 suspected Islamist militants were killed and 3 arrested in an early-morning operation by French Barkhane forces in Tin Afaghout in the Boughessa area.
At least 3 Fulani herders were killed by Dozo hunters in the Ke-Macina area.
One person was killed and 15 wounded when a bus hit an IED between Gossi and Hombori.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 4 MINUSMA peacekeepers were wounded when their vehicle hit an IED 50km south of Aguelhok.
2 people were abducted in Dialloube by suspected Islamist militants.
People protested against the designations for the Interim Authorities in Timbuktu.

9 traders, most of whom were from the Bozo ethnic group, were killed by armed Islamist militants in the Monimpe area, near Macina. The attack is believed to be related to recent ethnic violence in the area.
An ambush in Tonka by unidentified assailants resulted in 5 soldiers injured and 1 killed. 2 later died of their injuries.
4 soldiers were wounded when their vehicle hit an IED about 30km from Hombori.
Youths, civil society members and traders blocked Coulibaly Avenue to protest the suspension of asphalting of the avenue.
Local youths in Gossi captured bandits in their area and handed them over to Malian soldiers.

Employees Safety Assistance Volunteers (VADS) personnel starting to demonstrate in front of the governorate building in Bobo-Dioulasso were quickly cleared by police who used tear gas and batons. A police spokesman said the protest was illegal. No injuries were reported.

One militant was killed and 20 arrested during a Malian military operation in the Dialloube area that Ansar Dine affiliated militants are reported to frequent. Other people have also been reported missing following the operation.

source: Nord Sud Journal; AfrikInfos.net; Xinhua News Agency - French; AFP -- English; AFP; HRW
notes: 8 Fulani villagers were killed ic Ke-Macina commune, including 6 in Fokobougou, 1 in Diawaribougou, and 1 in Nawel-Baba, by members of the Bambara ethnic group after a Bambara trader was killed in Diawaribougou the day before. The violence was stopped by Malian soldiers who intervened, but shortly after more people were reported killed. The final fatality count was at least 21 killed. Other sources say as many as 32 more were killed. At least 16 people were reported injured.
Unidentified assailants opened fire on 2 agents of the Water & Forests Department between Timissa and Djenne, injuring one.
Malian military forces allegedly killed 4 unarmed villagers and arrested several others in Dialloube village. The area is known for being frequented by militants, including Ansar Dine affiliates.
Alleged Peuhl Islamist fighters killed a Bambara shopkeeper near the town of Ke-Macina

2 people were killed and 10 injured during a dispute between two groups of Mongo. A group related to a military chief in the region fired upon protesting students resulting in 2 deaths and injuries. It was not clear what led to the violence.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Looting: The CMA has accused GATIA of stealing their vehicles in the Menaka area and subjecting residents fo violence. GATIA rejected the claims of violence done to the population. The Malian government confirmed the thefts of vehicles but not the violence.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Property destruction: 4 trucks chartered by MINUSMA were reportedly burned between Boni and Hombori by unidentified gunmen. There were no reports of clashes or injuries.
A Malian military officer was shot 4 times by unidentified assailants and evacuated by French Barkhane troops. He later died of his injuries.
Violent protests were reported in Senou, just outside Bamako, where a crowd threatened to burn down the mayor's office. It was not reported what the people were protesting.

assoc_actor_1: SYTTBHA: Workers Union of Public Works, Building, Water and Similar
notes: SYTTBHA workers protested and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Infrastructure to demand resolution of their grievances.

assoc_actor_1: ONTTB: National Organisation of Burkinabe Land Carriers
notes: Truck drivers of the ONTTB protested and blocked the Ouaga-Kaya intersection to demand fewer road checks. They threatened to strike if nothing was done.
A Colombian nun was kidnapped by suspected FLM gunmen near Koutiala in the Sikasso region. The Colombian government claimed the FLM was responsible in April 2017.
A Malian soldier was killed and 4 others wounded when his vehicle hit a mine on the Goundam-Timbuktu road.

assoc_actor_1: SYNAFI: National Union of Finance Agents
notes: SYNAFI workers began an 11 day sit-in outside the ministry to demand their grievances be addressed.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: 4 Chadian MINUSMA peacekeepers were wounded after their vehicle hit an IED on the Aguelhok-Tessalit road.
4 Malian soldiers were killed and 3 wounded in an attack by an unidentified armed group on their positions in Menaka. At least 2 attackers were injured in the attack.
At least 2 gendarmes were killed and 3 people wounded, including 1 civilian, in an attack by unidentified assailants on a checkpoint in Marina, near Mopti.
Thousands of people protested in Niamey against the government for alleged "mismanagement", high costs of living and allowing the presence of western military bases in their country.
Property destruction: 3 trucks belonging to the French construction company SATOM were burned by unidentified gunmen in Niafunke.
4 Mauritanians were kidnapped in the Mbeiket area near the border with Mali, allegedly by pro-Bamako militiamen.
A municipal councilor and his son were killed by unidentified assailants in the Yorsala area, near Titao.
1 gendarmerie officer was killed and 2 injured in an attack on the Djiandiori-Tenenkou road. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility.
3 people were injured in an attack by unidentified armed motorcycle riders on a market in the Zinda area of Gao.
The mayor of Mondoro was killed by unidentified assailants.
Thousands of people protested in Nouakchott to demand the execution of a blogger convicted of apostasy.
Clashes between presumed Ansaroul Islam members and Dogon militia on the outskirts of Douna, Mopti not far from the Burkina Faso border, one Dogon killed and Dogon militia forced to retreat.
A local official was killed by unidentified armed assailants in Dinangourou.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a checkpoint in the Somadougou area. 2 civilians were wounded after the attack.
The mayor of Mondoro was killed in front of his home in Douentza by unidentified assailants.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA vehicle hit a IED while traveling along the Gao-Gossi road, causing no injuries.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: A crowd forced the release of 8 people imprisoned at a police station in Bagre. Following the events, clashes were reported between the rioters and police, which were later reinforced by gendarmerie forces. 37 people were arrested after the incident. No casualties were reported but some property was damaged.

Non-violent activity: Heavily armed Islamist militants were reported to have forced their way into schools in areas around Baraboule, including the Petega area of Pelem-Pelem and Lassa, and demanded teachers instruct their students on Islam and the Quran and stop teaching French. Burkinabe soldiers have been deployed to the area following the incidents.
An angry mob ransacked and looted the shop of an alleged confessed murderer in the Djikoroni Para district of Bamako.

Retired police and soldiers protested and staged a sit-in in front of the Ministry of Defence and Veteran's Affairs in Ouagadougou over the government's non-implementation of a shift in the retirement age.
1 Malian soldier was killed and others wounded in an IED attack on the Hombori-Douentza road.

Non-violent activity: The Nigerien, Malian and Burkinabe governments have created a Multinational Security Force (MSF) under the auspices of the Integrated Development Authority of the Liptako-Gourma Region (LGA) to more effectively fight against militancy along their shared borders.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.
Hundreds of people demonstrated in Bogande to demand the paving of the Taparko-Bogande-Fada road. Similar protests were held in Peila, Bilanga and Manni which are also along the same route.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A MINUSMA peacekeeper was killed in a mortar attack on a UN camp in Aguelhok. 2 other peacekeepers were seriously injured in the attack.
3 Malian soldiers were killed by a landmine while traveling on the Gao-Gossi axis.
Property destruction: Unknown gunmen entered a Chinese-owned entreprise 10km away from Ke-Macina and damaged 5 vehicles.
3 Malian soldiers were killed in a landmine explosion in the Diabaly area.

Two other common graves previously reported on by Human Rights Watch have yet to be investigated by the Malian authorities. The first, according to four witnesses from Yirima (35km from Boni), allegedly contains three members of an extended family detained by soldiers on January 21 and later executed.
2 Nigerien soldiers were killed and 7 others wounded in an attack by a large number of Boko Haram fighters on a military base in Geskerou in the Diffa region. 3 army vehicles were also torched.

Many Boko Haram fighters were killed (coded as 10) by Nigerien air strikes as they attempted to retreat through the marshes near Lake Chad after they attacked a military base at Geskerou in the Diffa region.
3 people arrested by FAMA soldiers at Yirma were allegedly executed in front of the villagers of Banguel.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: 13 GATIA members and one suspected CMA fighter were killed in an alleged CMA attack on GATIA fighters in the Tin Essako area of the Kidal region.
An IED attack against the Malian army was reported in the Goma-Coura area of Diabaly. Significant casualties were reported (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
The mayor of Boni was assassinated by unidentified gunmen.
An employee of the mayor's office in Salem, north of Timbuktu, was abducted by an unidentified group.
Dozens of journalists, rights activists and MPs protested in Nouakchott to call for the release of an Al Jazeera journalist detained in Egypt.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
assoc_actor_2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: At least 55 people were killed (including a bomber) and 100 wounded in a suicide car attack at a military camp in the northern city of Gao in Mali. The area houses government soldiers and armed groups who conduct mixed patrols under a UN-brokered peace deal aimed at curbing violence in the region. The perpetrators were Al Mourabitoun allied with AQIM. In mid-Feb MINUSMA revised the death toll down from 77 to 54.
A Malian army checkpost was attacked in Goundam by unidentified armed group. 1 person was killed, 4 injured and a vehicle and arms seized.
Students in Santa blocked National Road No.7 to demand attention to their grievances.
Teachers working in northern Mali in areas such as Timbuktu, Gao, Kidal, menaka and Taoudeni have started limited service over demands for risk premiums.
1,500 people marched silently in Ouagadougou to mark the anniversary of the Hotel Splendid attack.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM claimed a grad rocket attack targeting French forces at Timbuktu airport. It was not clear if the rockets caused any injuries/damage.
An explosion involving either an IED or Grad rocket was reported in Gao. No details about target or injuries.
2 people were killed by an IED blast outside the ANPE office in Kidal.

actor1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: The Union of Lawyers of Burkina Faso (SYNAF) reported that a lawyer had been assaulted by police while he had been attempting to interview a defendant who had been in custody for more than 5 days.
One person was killed and another injured when Burkinabe soldiers fired warnings shots at approaching motorcycles in the Banh area of Loroum province.
Arrests: French military forces arrested the mastermind of the Grand Bassam (Ivory Coast) attack which left 19 people dead in March 2016. The arrest was made in the village of Gossi in Mali.

5 Malian soldiers were killed and 3 wounded when their vehicle hit a roadside explosive while traveling between Diafarabe and Macina. The explosive was suspected of being planted by Islamist militants who regularly attack Malian security forces in the area.

Suspected Islamist fighters attacked the Kerboule mining site in Soum province, killing one Koglweogo member and 3 miners, injuring one other, and stealing 6 motorcycles and an unspecified sum of money. Islamist militias have been known to operate in the area.
A suspected cattle thief was killed by unidentified gunmen between Dala and Kerena in the Douentza area.
On 9 January, unknown gunmen abducted three young men of the Imghad tribe in the area of Tidarmene.
A Malian military patrol was ambushed in Fafa village by unidentified assailans. After a gunfight, 3 assailants were arrested and handed over to the local gendarmerie.

assoc_actor_1: PNDS: Nigerien Party for Democracy and Socialism
notes: As many as 20,000 people took part in a march in Niamey in support of the current government and President Mahamadou Issoufou. The event was organized by the ruling MNR coalition and was led by the president of the PNDS (the main ruling party).
Rallies were held against the continued use of the CFA in Burkina Faso.
The Mourabitoun Battalion claimed responsibility for an attack on FAMA soldiers at a checkpoint in Ansongo. No casualties reported.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: An ICRC official was killed in Gao by unidentified assailants.
"Future Engineers" Association protested in front of the parliament to call for supporting their demands, amongs others creating jobs for the unemployed engineers.
Agreement: 20 more members of Boko Haram have surrendered in Diffa.
Non-violent activity: An assassination attempt was reported in the Djibo area. Ansaroul Islam claimed responsibility.
An assassination was conducted in the Sibe area. The identity of the target was not reported. Ansaroul Islam claimed responsibility.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the Malian gendarmerie in Gossi. The gendarmerie offices and a hanger were set on fire during the attack.
Members of an Al Qaeda affiliated group, Ansaroul Islam, seriously injured anotther former member of the group in Djibo. The man was allegedly a deserter of the group.
Members of an Al Qaeda affiliated group, Ansaroul Islam, killed an imam in a reprisal attack in the Tongomayel commune, in the village of Sibe. The imam had allegedly deserted the group.

source: Xinhua News Agency - French; AFP; Vanguard (Lagos)
notes: At least 3 soldiers and 5 Boko Haram militants were killed in an attack on army positions in the Marouwa area of Diffa region. 7 more soldiers were wounded in the attack. Other reports said as many as 15 Boko Haram militants were killed and one captured.

assoc_actor_1: SYNAPAR: National Union of Research Support Staff
notes: SYNAPAR members staged a sit-in at the Institute of Environment and Agricultural Research in Ouagadougou to demand a sepcific allowance and expansion of a premium for their research.
Agreement: 30 Boko Haram fighters surrendered to the authorities in Nigers Diffa region.
A French woman who runs a humanitarian organization focused on helping children was kidnapped in Gao by Al Mourabitoune
A Malian police officer was killed and another wounded in an attack on a police station at Saye in Mopti.
Unidentified gunmen occupied the Boni area in Mopti without violence.
At least 10,000 people, including striking civil servants and traders, protested against the allegedly mismanagement of President Issoufous government and rising costs of living.
Mauritanian police dispersed a demonstration demanding the death sentence for a young blogger accused of blasphemy. The several hundred protesters were dispersed with tear gas.

Students and parents fought, resulting in several wounded, 15 motorcycles wrecked, and some damage to property, in a high school theatre in Niangoloko. The violence was related to a local school dispute.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: Non-violent activity: The main Tuareg rebel coalition suspended its participation in the peace process, accusing the Malian government of failing to prevent recent violence and lack of progress on promised reforms.

Two other common graves previously reported on by Human Rights Watch have yet to be investigated by the Malian authorities. The second grave allegedly contains five men from Isseye village detained and executed by soldiers on December 19, 2016
5 men from Isseye village were detained and later executed by Malian soldiers near Yirma.
5 men were detained by Malian soldiers in Isseye village in the Douentza area. Their bodies were allegedly later discovered in a mass grave near the village.
People of the Tangin Dassouri rural commune staged a peaceful march to demand that the authorities release Adam Zongo, a former mayor and former president of the FEDAP/BC.

source: The Long War Journal; Xinhua News Agency - French
notes: At least 12 soldiers were killed in an attack by about 40 heavily armed gunmen on a Burkinabe military post on the border with Mali at Nassoumbou. An al-Qaeda-linked group calling itself Ansaroul Islam claimed the attack.
4 Malian soldiers were killed by unidentified assailants who ambushed a convoy headed to Sevare from Boni.
Some parents and their kids gathered at two high schools in NDjamena to demand the government negotiate with striking teachers so the strike can end.
Hundreds of demonstrators engaged in 13 minutes of silence and staged a sit-in outside the Ouagadougou courthouse to demand action over the death of an investigative journalist, Norbert Zongo.

actor1: Military Forces of Libya (2014-) Haftar Faction
actor2: FACT: Front for Alteration and Harmony in Chad
notes: A Chadian rebel group, FACT, claims it was bombed by the Libyan air forces of Khalifa Haftar in the Jebel Saoudah area of northern Chad. The attack killed 1 and wounded 2.
11 people were killed, including 8 farmers and 3 pastoralists, in clashes between the two groups in the Abeche area.
A group of women staged a protest in Moundou in solidarity with striking labour union members, teachers and students. Some of those who participated were arrested.

Supporters of an MPP mayor of Ouagadougous 8th district staged violent protests after a vote of no confidence went against the mayor. The rioters ransacked and burned the homes of three councillors from the UPC and 2 from the MPP.

source: The Long War Journal; Xinhua General News Service; AFP
notes: At least one prison guard was killed, another person injured, and between 50-93 prisoners released in an attack on a jail claimed by Ansar Dine.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: On 4 December, a convoy of GATIA combatants entered the village of Tidarmene, seized three vehicles and five motorbikes, two other vehicles were damaged, three shops were also looted and two civilians abducted, they were released a few hours later.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: On 4 December, GATIA combatants raided the village of Intadayne, seized fuel and foodstuff and also abducted a health worker and his assistant, who were beaten and later released. Two elderly villagers were also physically abused.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: On 3 December, a convoy of GATIA combatants entered the village of Inguizal in the cercle of Tidarmene, several shops were looted and civilians mistreated. Several property also stolen in the area in the days that followed.

actor1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: Gendarmerie from Koudougou shot dead a man "dressed all in white and turbaned" who refused police demands to stop as he was traveling towards their post.
On 1 December, unknown gunmen attacked a civilian transport bus near Gringale, wounding seven passengers including three severely, Malian soldiers were among the passengers on board the bus.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: 2 people were killed in clashes between suspected CMA and GATIA fighters between Tessit and Intillit near the Nigerien border.

A lookout, who turned out to be a minor, was killed by a French helicopter patrol near Tigabatene, 60km from Tessalit. The patrol was looking for people planting roadsibe explosives after a few French vehicles had been attacked over the past month.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: A GATIA vehicle hit an IED in Kidal, killing 5 of its members. Ansar Dine is suspected in planting the explosive.

assoc_actor_1: FNDU: National Forum for Democracy and Unity
notes: A large gathering of opposition members from the FNDU, RFD and UNAD parties in Nouakchott denounced the "looting of national resources" and mismanagement by the government. 8 youths involved in the protest were arrested.
A man fired on the embassy of the US in Ndjamena but was fought off by Chadian security officers who barricaded the entrance. He is believed to be affiliated with IS.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM claimed a grad rocket attack on a French military base at Timbuktu airport. None of the rockets landed in the perimeter of the base however.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: The Al Mourabitoun Battalion, a sub-group of the AQIM, claimed a suicide car bombing which targeted a UN facility at Gao airport. No one was injured besides the bomber. Another car bomb was allegedly detonated remotely around the same time.
Ansar Dine claimed an IED attack against French forces in the Abeibara locality. No casualties were reported.
At least 2 Nigerien gendarmes were killed in an ambush of their convoy in Bankilare. Ansar Dine and AQIM have both been active in the area.
Health workers marched on the second day of their 72-hour strike to demand better security for them at their workplaces.

actor1: ANSIPRJ: National Alliance for the Protection of the Fulani Identity and the Restoration of Justice
notes: Agreement: A Peul ethnic militia, the National Alliance for the Protection of the Peul (Fulani) Identity, have agreed to give up their arms and join the reconciliation process.

assoc_actor_1: FONAC: New Opposition Front for Change
notes: Strikes: A dead city protest strike was staged in Ndjamena to protest against the governments "undermining of the foundation of democracy" according to the vice-president of the UNDR. The strike was called by FONAC.
A candidate for local elections was kidnapped in the Koro region on voting day.

source: BBC Monitoring Africa - Political; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: An Islamist militia attacked the town of Dilli, killing one civilian and stealing 2 ambulances before heading for the Mauritanian border. This occurred in the evening following local elections in Mali.
Property destruction: Ballot boxes were seized and burned in Timbuktu, as well as other cities in the north.

actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
notes: 4 Malian soldiers were killed and several others injured during an ambush by suspected CMA fighters in the Bambara-Maounde area.

source: Maghreb Emergent (French); BBC Monitoring Africa - Political; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: 5 Malian soldiers transporting ballot boxes were killed and others wounded during an ambush by suspected Islamist fighters in the Douentza area. Other sources said the CMA carried out the attack.
100 youths marched in Banfora to protest against actions by some politicians to block the Banfora city council and dismiss the mayor.
3 civilians were killed in a raid by Boko Haram on Wor village. The attackers also burned some huts before retreating.
The police used tear gas to disperse a manifestation of individuals demanding the execution of Mohamed Ould MKheitir, a blogger sentenced to death for "apostasy" in 2015.

assoc_actor_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
notes: Members of the National Union of Human and Animal Health (SYNTSHA), observed a sit-in on Nov. 16 and 17 at the regional hospital in Ouahigouya. The protesters demand the satisfaction of their platform of demands.

assoc_actor_1: UNDR: National Union for Democracy and Renewal
source: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
notes: The security forces disperse protesters with tear gas on the street as they marched towards a stadium after holding a public meeting at the headquarters of Kebzabos party, the UNDR, in an attempt by the opposition to defy a ban by President Idriss Debys government on a demonstration organised as public anger soared over the nations growing economic crisis. 30 people were arrested.

assoc_actor_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
notes: Members of the National Union of Human and Animal Health (SYNTSHA), observed a sit-in on Nov. 16 and 17 at the regional hospital in Ouahigouya. The protesters demand the satisfaction of their platform of demands.

actor2: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
notes: Ansar Dine attacked on Wednesday a convoy of armed Tuareg Tribe in the Kidal region. Three fighters of Gatia were killed. The attack took place in the locality of Tisawached (Kidal region), not far from the Algerian border.

Hundreds protested Tuesday in Mauritania calling for a blogger convicted of "infidel" behaviour to be executed. Cheikh Ould Mohamed Ould Mkheitir was initially sentenced to death for apostasy in 2014 over a blog post deemed insulting to the Prophet Mohammed.

A councilman of the village of Soboule, 30 kilometers from Nassoumbou, was wounded by unidentified armed man. While his gun jammed, the attacker was then lynched by the crowd, who then handed over to the defense and security forces.

Amadou Boli, the Imam preacher in sector 5 of Djibo and number 2 of Irshad (Network of preachers), was attacked at his home by armed men. While the motive under this murdr is unclear, a showdown seems to be behind this attack.

In Petega, 30 kilometers from Nassoumbou, Tamboura Amadou Oumarou, a village councilman, was murdered by four bullets in the head, and Dicko Hamadoum, a village resident, was kidnapped by the armed men.

A councilman of the village of Soboule, 30 kilometers from Nassoumbou, was wounded by unidentified armed man. While his gun jammed, the attacker was then lynched by the crowd, who then handed over to the defense and security forces.
Two Malian soldiers were wounded when members of Al-Mourabitoun on motorcycles attacked an army position near Gao.

Clashes between students and security forces over the strike of teachers which lasts for several months and the payment of their scholarship. Students burned tires and erected barricades while police responded with tear gas. Dozens of arrests and wounded among the protesters.
Strikes: Several health unions in Mali are on strike since Nov. 10 following an agreement reached Wednesday between unions and the government.

source: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
notes: Five soldiers were killed, three injured and four others missing following an attack on Tuesday in the town of Banibangou. Two of the attackers were also killed in the raid, and that 26 others were arrested with weapons and ammunition. The Islamic State group is said to be behind this attack.

source: PANAPRESS - Pan African News Agency (French); Maghreb Emergent (French)
notes: The Mauritanian forces violently dispersed a demonstration in the Port of Nouakchott. Around 20 people arrested while police used tear gas and batons.
An international NGO convoy was attacked Monday night Nov. 7 near Timbuktu, at ten kilometers of Tounka, and the vehicle stolen. The toll is three dead in the shooting.
An IED blast hit a French vehicle in the Abeibara area near Aguelhok. Ansar Dine has claimed responsibility.

An armed Islamist group executed the head of the village of Diaba. One villager said he believed the killing was a warning to the community to not work with the Malian army, whose presence had recently been reinforced in the area.

source: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International; Maghreb Emergent (French); Twitter.com; Long War Journal
notes: A policeman and a Malian prison officer were missing Monday, allegedly abducted, after an attack by Ansar Dine on the night of Sunday to Monday against the Malian town of Banamba. Two vehicles of the Gendarmerie were seized by the gunmen. According to the sources, the attackers arrived in Banamba "aboard a dozen vehicles" were immediately divided into three groups. One group attacked the local gendarmerie, another group attacked the jail to free prisoners, and a third headed a bank on site to force the safe. 21 inmates were released from a prison. One of the two missing men was found on Nov. 8 while the second on Nov. 9.
Strike to protest against a reform of the activity in the port of Nouakchott. Thirty dockers were arrested on Monday after clashes with security forces.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
source: Agence France Presse; Al-Akhbar; Long War Journal
notes: A UN peacekeeper from Togo and two Malian civilians were killed Sunday at around 10:30 am (1030 GMT) when a MINUSMA logistics convoy was the target of a complex attack 45 kilometres (30 miles) north of Douentza, in the Mopti region. After a mine or improvised explosive device was detonated and the attackers opened fire on the convoy. Many sources reported Ansar Dine has claimed the responsibility while on Nov. 8 the Al-Akhbar website reports El Mourabitoune has also claimed responsibility for detonating a bomb that targeted Malian army truck although there are no more confirmations about.

source: Agence France Presse; Long War Journal
notes: Ansar Dines forces attacked a military camp in Gourma Rhaous, in Tombouctou, burning military equipment and temporarily taking control over the outpost. Additionally, the group claimed to capture 5 vehicles, burned another 6, and captured at least one DShK machine gun. It also reported that one of its own fighters was killed in that attack.

source: Agence France Presse; Long War Journal
notes: A French soldier was killed by a landmine. On the same day, a third French vehicle was hit by an IED near Kidal. All three were claimed by Ansar Dine. Ansar Dine claimed responsibility for the attack. The killing of this soldier raised the French victims in Mali to 16, since January 2013.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
assoc_actor_2: Tuareg Ethnic Group (Mali); Al Furqan Battalion
source: Agence France Presse; Long War Journal; Human Rights Watch
notes: Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM), on Friday night released a video showing the execution of 4 people, including two Tuareg captives and two other Malians, Mohamed Ould Beih and El-Hussein, accused of collaboration with the French military forces in Mali to fight the jihadists. Location unidentified.

assoc_actor_1: SYNATEB: National Union of Basic Education Workers
notes: Teachers of the National Union of Basic Education Workers section Bourzanga, observed a 48h work stoppage.
At the University of Zinder, clashes took place between students and police over the payment of scholarships and especially a steady supply of food in the university restaurant.

source: Agence France Presse; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: At least 18 people were killed and 43 others wounded in clashes between farmers and herders near Bangui, a town in the region of Tahoua (west). 38 suspected arrested. Some days after, two persons succumbed to their injuries raising the deaths at 20.

Several thousand people in the city of Yendabli took the street in tribute to the victims of the uprising population of 30 and 31 October 2014 and the failed coup of 16 September 2015 in Fada-NGourma.
Hundreds of people marching in protest against the appointment of the interim authorities in the North of Mali

source: BBC Monitoring; Radio France Internationale; Long War Journal
notes: Non-violent activity: On 30 October 2016 al-Qaedas rival Islamic State group (IS) reported it had received a pledge of allegiance by "Al-Murabitun" under the leadership of Abu-al-Walid al-Sahrawi, while part of Al-Murabitun remains loyal to al-Qaeda.

The Mujahideen attacked a French barrack in the city of Kidal with several shells and missiles. No casualties were reported, but two Bangladeshi helicopters were damaged by the rockets. Ansar Eddine claimed responsibility for the attack.

assoc_actor_1: FNDU: National Forum for Democracy and Unity
notes: Thousands of people marched in Nouakchott before ending up for a rally in the city center, the call of the National Forum for Unity and Democracy (FNDU), a coalition of a dozen parties of the radical opposition.

Chadian judges decided on Friday to stop work for two weeks on the whole territory, protesting against the 50% of allowances and bonuses for state employees, decided by the government to mitigate the effects of the financial and economic crisis affecting the country.

assoc_actor_1: SYNATIC: Autonomous Syndicate of Information and Culture Workers
notes: The Independent Union of Workers of information and culture (Synatic) start 96 hours of general strike. The strikers decided to set up their picket outside the headquarters of the National Television of Burkina. But there, they were stopped by security forces deployed there.
3 civilians were killed when unidentified gunmen attacked a toll post in Dialakoroba. The assailants allegedly shouted "Allahu Akbar" during the events.
The Minister of Internal Security claimed that a "jihadist recruiter" armed with a grenade was killed by security forces in the Kilwin neighbourhood of Ouagadougou.
A nurse was killed when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a vehicle belonging to a health centre in the Dimamou area of Mopti. Jihadist militants were suspected in the attack.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: AQIM abducted the chief of Kel Ansar Tuareg militia end October 2016 on suspicion of collaboration with Malian security forces. He was released by JNIM - a newly formed Al Qaida entity - early May 2017.

About 8 heavily-armed unidentified assailants, believed to have crossed the border from Mali, attacked Kerboule village, in the Nassoumbou area. They killed 4 people and injured one before Kolgweogo self-defense militiamen from Boulsa arrived, causing the gunmen to retreat. The gunmen were allegedly speaking in Fulani.

About 8 heavily-armed unidentified assailants, believed to have crossed the border from Mali, attacked Kerboule village, in the Nassoumbou area. They killed 4 people and injured one before Kolgweogo self-defense militiamen from Boulsa arrived, causing the gunmen to retreat. The gunmen were allegedly speaking in Fulani.

source: Long War Journal; Agence France Presse -- English; RFI
notes: Malian-based militants attacked Koutoulake prison close to Niamey which houses militants from al-Qaeda, Boko Haram and other militant groups active in the area. One attacker was killed during the attack and 2 guards injured. IS later claimed responsibility for the attack.

4 soldiers were killed during an ambush by suspected Macina Liberation Front gunmen (based on similar attacks by the group), which began after one of their vehicles hit a landmine . The attack took place as their convoy was traveling between Diabaly and Nampala. 9 soldiers were also seriously wounded.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
source: Long War Journal; Agence France Presse
notes: An American aid worker with the NGO Youth with a Mission was kidnapped and two people, a bodyguard and a Nigerien national guardsman, were killed in an attack by suspected AQIM fighters in Abalak. Government sources claimed the kidnappers headed for the Malian border.
Several teachers unions in Niger began a 3-day strike. Teachers also staged a march through the streets of Niamey.

source: Sidwaya (Ouagadougou); Fasozine; Long War Journal; Associated Press
notes: 3 soldiers and 2 civilians were killed in an attack on a military position in Intangom, near Tin Akoff. 1 soldier was also wounded during the incident. The Islamic State in the Greater Sahara later claimed the attack. Another soldier later died of his injuries.
Non-violent activity: 50 Boko Haram members raided the Diffa area and robbed shops, pharmacies, health centres and other buildings. No casualties were reported however.

assoc_actor_1: SYNATRACT: National Union of Workers of the Local Authorities
notes: Staff of the regional authority engaged in a protest strike and demonstrated in front of the Ouagadougou Labour Exchange to demand attention to their grievances. The general secretary of SYNATRACT was in attendance.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
source: Agence France Presse -- English; Radio France Internationale
notes: A suspected Islamist suicide bomber detonated his vest in an attempted attack on Swedish MINUSMA peacekeepers in Timbuktu on the night of Oct.10. No casualties were reported however.

assoc_actor_1: IRA: Resurgence of the Abolitionist Movement
notes: After police prevented them from marching, IRA ativists staged a sit-in in solidarity with 13 IRA activists who were arrested and jailed in June after violent protests over the dismantling of a slum of Nouakchott.
6 French soldiers were lightly wounded when their vehicle hit an IED or mine north of the Abeibara area.

actor1: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
assoc_actor_1: HCUA: High Council for the Unity of Azawad
notes: The military leader of the HCUA, a member of the CMA coalition, was killed when his vehicle hit a mine in the Kidal after a meeting at MINUSMAs offices in the area.
About 1,000 people demonstrated in Bamako to demand an end to legal action against a popular radio host.

actor1: Former Military Forces of Burkina Faso (1987-2014)
actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: 4 assailants accosted 2 gendarmes and attempted to steal their weapons near the Po gendarmerie station at Nazinon. 2 of the suspects were killed, while one of the attackers and a police officer were wounded. The government later claimed they were members of the disbanded Presidential Security Regiment.

actor1: Former Military Forces of Burkina Faso (1987-2014)
notes: Non-violent activity: Burkina Fasos Minister of Territorial Administration, Decentralization and Homeland Security claims that a coup attempt was foiled on Oct.8 which had been organized by members of the disbanded Presidential Security Regiment. Members of the former regiment who did not participate allegedly informed the government about the plan.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
source: Long War Journal; Xhinua News Agency - French
notes: The Nigerien government confirmed that 22 Nigerien soldiers were killed in an attack by suspected AQIM fighters on a Malian refugee camp in the Tazalit area of Tassara commune. At least one refugee was also injured and an ambulance burned. The attackers arrived in a column made up of at least 13 vehicles and a motorcycle and fled after the attack.
Residents of the Soubeira area marched to Kaya to demand the involvement of the regional administrator in the resolution of a dispute in their area.

assoc_actor_1: CNSE: National Coordination of Education Unions
notes: The CNSE organized a protest march of sixteen teachers unions to commemorate World Teachers Day and deliver a memo to the Minister of Education.

source: Associated Press International; Agence France Presse
notes: At least 2 Malian soldiers were killed and 2 injured when their vehicle hit a land mine in the Timbuktu area. No group claimed responsibility.
Primary teachers of Boulgou province protested in Tankodogo to demand an education conference that was meant to be held in 2015 be held.

assoc_actor_1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
source: Long War Journal; Xhinua News Agency - French
notes: A Malian soldier was killed during an attack on civilians being escorted by the military along the Goundam-Timbuktu road by suspected al Furqan Battalion (AQIM) fighters. 2 civilians were also injured in the assault and 2 assailants arrested.

Striking students from Niamey University erected barricades in front of their campus and blocked traffic to demand attention to their grievances. Police were deployed but did not engage the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: UST: Union of Chadian Trade Unions
notes: Strikes: The UST launched a strike in the health and education sectors to protest against austerity measures taken out by the government. Employees at the General Hospital in NDjamena only offered minimum service while colleges, public schools and universties were closed.
A civilian was killed by a landmine in the Aguelhok area.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Ansar Dine fighters claimed a Grad rocket attack on a UN base in the Aguelhok area. No casualties were reported but a truck was destroyed. A second round of firing using mortars later in the day did no damage. After the first round of shelling, a Chadian patrol sent out to find the culprits hit an IED claimed by Ansar Dine. One peacekeeper was killed in the blast and at least 5 were seriously wounded; one later died of his injuries. Finally, an ambulance belonging to the Chadian MINUSMA contingent was hit by an IED as it went to pick up injured from the earlier IED. 8 people were injured during the events in total.

assoc_actor_1: URD: Union for the Republic and Democracy
source: Xinhua News Agency - French; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: According to the police, at least 2,000 people (opposition est. 100,000) engaged in a march in Bamako called by Malis opposition to demand the return of former Malian Presdient Amadou Toumani Toure, and to protest against a new electoral law and alleged state censorship. Opposition leader Soumaila Cisse of the URD spoke during the event, while former prime minister Modibo Sidibe was also present. Police seem to have been present but did not intervene.
About 5,000 people demonstrated for the release of Djibril Bassole, a former Foreign Minister of President Campaores government, in his hometown of Reo. He was arrested in mid-September.

Several dozen activists of the TPN movement staged a sit-in outside the offices of the Department of Justice in Nouakchott to demand action against a police officer who allegedly killed a student in Maghama in 2011.
Workers of the National Blood Transfusion Centre held a 48-hour sit-in outside the premises of the centre in Ouagadougou to demand the implementation of a rebate to the centres workers.
Former workers of Bissa Gold staged a sit-in to demand their unpaid severance following their October 2015 dismissals.
A Malian soldier and a civilian were killed in an allegedly Islamist militant ambush in Timbuktu.

Students of the University of NDjamena demonstrated in support of their strike (launched 10 days prior, on 15 September) to protest the abolition of scholarships. Police in riot gear were deployed to disperse the protesters, who had burned tires and smashed windows in some cases. 4 student leaders involved in the events were arrested the next day, and released on Sept.28.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: A national guardsmen was executed by AQIM in Timbuktu. The circumstances of his capture were not reported.

source: Agence France Presse -- English; Agence Congolaise de Presse (French)
notes: 4 Chadian soldiers were killed in a raid by Boko Haram fighters into Chad near the Djoroye area on the border with Niger. 6 others were injured. Boko Haram allegedly lost 7 fighters in the fighting.
3 Boko Haram members were captured by villagers after they attempted to enter their area near Diffa during the night. They were later transferred to the local gendarmerie.
Strikes: The SN-AS-PF and SYNACAM unions called a 48-strike to protest against their unfulfilled demands of the government.
SYNATEL began a strike and sit-in at ONATEL to demand resolution of their grievances.

assoc_actor_1: SYNTSHA: National Union of Human and Animal Health Workers
notes: SYNTSHA workers began a 4-day, 4-hour work stoppage at the Yalgado-Ouedraogo hospital along with sit-ins to draw attention to their grievances.
A Malian soldier was killed and 4 wounded in an ambush by a suspected Islamist militia between the towns of Gossi and Doro. A military vehicle and a tank were also destroyed during the attack.

actor1: GATIA: Imghad Tuareg and Allies Self-Defense Group
actor2: CMA: Coordination of Movements of the Azawad
source: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse -- English
notes: GATIA attacked a CMA position in the Intachdayte area of Kidal. The CMA claimed to have lost 6 fighters, while 12 people were allegedly killed overall in the violence.
Arrests: Burkina Fasos former PM under the government of President Blaise Compaore, Luc-Adolphe Tiao, was arrested on charges of murder.
Strike:Strikes:Students at the University of NDjamena went on strike over the expected abolition of scholarships.

In mid-September a scholar of the Quran living in Sofara was killed for his alleged collaboration with the Malian army. Witnesses said that soldiers had visited his house several times while on patrol in the area where militants also operate.

On Sept.30, a spokesman of Nigers defense ministry claimed that 123 Boko Haram militants and 14 Nigerien soldiers have been killed in joint operations with Chadian forces in the Diffa area since the beginning of July (7 soldier and 38 Boko Haram fatalities coded in other events; new fatalities divided between July, August and September in 3 events). 29 soldiers were also wounded and 2 Boko Haram members captured.

38 Boko Haram fighters were killed in joint Nigerien/Chadian military operations around Gueskerou and Toumour between Sept.12-14 (30 fatalities coded in a previous event). 2 soldiers were lightly wounded and substantial quantities of weapons and ammunitions seized.
Nigerien and Chadian armed forces conducted airstrikes against Boko Haram positions ahead of a planned offensive.
The civil registry of Sabse department was burned down by demonstrators demanding the dissolution of a newly-installed city council in the area.

38 Boko Haram fighters were killed in joint Nigerien/Chadian military operations around Gueskerou and Toumour between Sept.12-14 (30 fatalities coded in a previous event). 2 soldiers were lightly wounded and substantial quantities of weapons and ammunitions seized.
5 Nigerien soldiers were killed and 6 others wounded in an ambush by Boko Haram fighters at Bosso in the Diffa area.

After a Boko Haram attack killed 5 soldiers, the Nigerien military responded with operations in the Gueskerou and Toumour areas that killed 30 and captured 2 Boko Haram fighters and recovered a large quantity of arms and ammunition.

After a Boko Haram attack killed 5 soldiers, the Nigerien military responded with operations in the Gueskerou and Toumour areas that killed 30 and captured 2 Boko Haram fighters and recovered a large quantity of arms and ammunition.
2 Malian refugees and a policeman were killed and 4 wounded in an attack on the Tabarey Barey refugee camp in the Ayorou district by unidentified assailants.

actor1: ANSIPRJ: National Alliance for the Protection of the Fulani Identity and the Restoration of Justice
notes: A recently created group, ANSIPRJ, claim responsibility for an ambush in Boni which claims the lives of three Malian soldiers.
2 Nigerien soldiers were killed and 2 others injured when their vehicle hit an IED planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters near Baroua.
2 people were killed and 10 others injured by the Koglweogo vigilante group from Burkina Faso who claimed to have tracked down suspected bandits to an area across the border with Niger.

actor1: MJRN: Movement for Justice and the Rehabilitation of Niger
notes: Formation of armed group: A new armed group called the Movement for Justice and the Rehabilitation of Niger has threatened to launch attacks in the uranium-rich west African country of Niger to protest against the marginalisation of the minority Toubou population.

source: Agence France Presse -- English; Long War Journal
notes: The Malian army retook Boni from suspected Ansar Dine fighters which took it the day before. They escaped the town with a local official they had taken hostage.

Ansar Dine claimed responsibility for an attack on a military checkpost in the town of San. They stormed the building, stole weapons and motrocycles, and burnt it down before retreating. No casualties were reported.

source: Les Depeches de Brazzaville; Long War Journal
notes: About 40 suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked Boni and forced the retreat of Malian military forces to the south of the city. The Islamists, some of whom had been waiting in the town for reinforcements before the attack, planted a flag in the town and ransacked administrative offices and a security post. No casualties were reported.

source: Agence France Presse; Long War Journal
notes: 2 customs officials (including a border guard) were killed in an attack on the border town of Markoye. 3 people were also wounded. The assailants stole customs money and fled to the Nigerien border. The leader of the Islamic States Sahara division claimed responsibility for the attack.

5 civilians were killed and 2 wounded in a Boko Haram attack on Toumour (allegedly the first in 3 months). The attackers rode into town on camels and burned buildings before treating towards Nigeria. They were opposed by locals who were armed with bows and arrows.

assoc_actor_1: SYNATIC: Autonomous Syndicate of Information and Culture Workers
notes: SYNATIC workers staged a sit-in to demand attention to their grievances.
Suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked a military post in the Boulkessi area, near Mondoro. No casualties were reported.
Suspected Ansar Dine fighters attacked a police sation in the Bandigara area in the Mopti region.

actor1: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: A UN vehicle hit an IED near Ansongo.
Malian soldiers were ambushed by a suspected Islamist militia near Boni. Two of their vehicles were captured and burned.

source: Radio France Internationale; Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse
notes: A clash between herders and farmers from the Fulani ethnic group left 5 dead and 7 wounded at Tabital Pulaaku in the Tenenkou area of Mopti. One militia ambushed another looking for stolen animals in the village of Tekere Finadji.
Dozens of protesters were arrested and many injuries were reported after demonstrations over power shortages turned violent in Arlit.

source: Agence France Presse; Radio France Internationale; Camer.be
notes: Four Chadian soldiers have been killed after a mine planted by Boko Haram Islamists destroyed their vehicle. The explosion occurred in Kaiga Kindji, near the border of Chad and Niger.
A vigilante militant killed a rider in Yonde.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: Local sources claimed that French forces clashed with AQIM fighters in Tabakort.

Ansar Dine claims to have attacked a Malian military checkpoint in Mopti. Their statement says they fired on the post which caused the soldiers there to retreat, before stealing motorcycles and weapons.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Africa News; Xinhua General News Service
notes: Hundreds protested the recent arrest of radio presenter Rasbath. Police fired tear gas and bullets, and protesters responded by throwing blunt objects; at least one protester killed and 11 injured.
An IED attack targeting a French armored vehicle outside Abeidara was claimed by Ansar Dine. No casualties were reported.
After Ansar Dine fired mortars at a joint MINUSMA-French base in Amachach, they claim to have planted an IED which hit a French patrol sent out to scan the area, killing 2 soldiers.

actor2: MINUSMA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (2013-)
notes: Ansar Dine claimed to have fired rockets or mortars at the joint MINUSMA-French base at Amachach near Tessalit. No casualties were reported.
Strikes: Miners at a major gold mine owned by Kinross in Tasiast went on strike for 18 days. The strike was ended in August after a successful agreement between the workers and the company.

At least 5 killed in attack attributed to Boko Haram.

Northerners residing in Bamako held a peaceful protest to express solidarity with Gao, after protesters were recently killed there.

In the Menaka region, French forces killed about 10 fighters from Al Mourabitoun Battalion over two days of fighting.

source: Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International

Police arrested several students who were protesting poor transportation at the University of Nouakchott.

Two soldiers injured and one army vehicle stolen when Islamist militants attacked a military post.

source: Radio France Internationale; Agence France Presse - English; Associated Press International
